de.Lathanael.BinaryFileDB.BaseClass
Class RecordsFile

java.lang.Object
  de.Lathanael.BinaryFileDB.BaseClass.BaseRecordsFile
      de.Lathanael.BinaryFileDB.BaseClass.RecordsFile

public class RecordsFile
extends BaseRecordsFile

Implements BaseRecordsFile to create a low-level binary file database.

Author:
original by: Derek Hamner (http://www.javaworld.com/javaworld/jw-01-1999/jw-01-step.html?page=1), modified by: Lathanael (aka Philippe Leipold)

Field Detail

memIndex

protected java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,IndexEntry> memIndex
ConcurrentHashMap which holds the in-memory index. For efficiency, the entire index is cached in memory. The ConcurrentHashMap maps a key of type String to an IndexEntry.

freeRecordSpace

protected java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentSkipListMap<java.lang.Integer,IndexEntry> freeRecordSpace
ConcurrentSkipListMap which holds a in-memory map of free Record space and the corresponding IndexEntry. If there are 2 Records with the same free space only the first will be mapped in this map.

cachedRecords

protected java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,RecordReader> cachedRecords
In-Memory cache of recently accessed records in form of ReacordReaders.

cacheSize

protected int cacheSize
The amount of records which should be cached.

Constructor Detail

RecordsFile

public RecordsFile(java.lang.String dbPath,
                   int initialSize,
                   int cacheSize)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   RecordsFileException,
                   CacheSizeException
Creates a new database file. The initialSize parameter determines the
amount of space which is allocated for the index. The index can grow
dynamically, but the parameter is provided to increase efficiency.

Parameters:
dbPath - - Pathname where the file is located as a String
initialSize - - Size of the db created
cacheSize - - Size of the initial cache for recently loaded RecordReaders. Must be greater 0!
Throws:
CacheSizeException
java.io.IOException
RecordsFileException

RecordsFile

public RecordsFile(java.lang.String dbPath,
                   int initialSize,
                   int cacheSize,
                   int MAX_KEY_LENGTH,
                   int DATA_START_HEADER_LOCATION,
                   int FILE_HEADERS_REGION_LENGTH,
                   int RECORD_HEADER_LENGTH)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   RecordsFileException,
                   CacheSizeException
Creates a new database file. The initialSize parameter determines the
amount of space which is allocated for the index. The index can grow
dynamically, but the parameter is provided to increase
efficiency. Let's the user define the length of keys etc.

Parameters:
dbPath - - Pathname where the file is located as a String
initialSize - - Size of the db created
cacheSize - - Size of the initial cache for recently loaded RecordReaders. Must be greater 0!
MAX_KEY_LENGTH - - MAX_KEY_LENGTH
DATA_START_HEADER_LOCATION - - DATA_START_HEADER_LOCATION
FILE_HEADERS_REGION_LENGTH - - FILE_HEADERS_REGION_LENGTH
RECORD_HEADER_LENGTH - RECORD_HEADER_LENGTH
Throws:
CacheSizeException
java.io.IOException

RecordsFile

public RecordsFile(java.lang.String dbPath,
                   java.lang.String accessFlags,
                   int cacheSize)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   RecordsFileException,
                   CacheSizeException
Opens an existing database and initializes the in-memory index.

Parameters:
dbPath - - Pathname where the file is located as a String
accessFlags - - Whether the new DBFile should hava read-only "r" or read/write "rw" access
cacheSize - - Size of the initial cache for recently loaded RecordReaders. Must be greater 0!
Throws:
CacheSizeException
java.io.IOException
RecordsFileException

RecordsFile

                   int FILE_HEADERS_REGION_LENGTH,

Opens an existing database and initializes the in-memory index
and let's the user define the length of keys etc.

allocateRecord

protected IndexEntry allocateRecord(java.lang.String key,
                                    int dataLength)
                             throws RecordsFileException,
                                    java.io.IOException
This method searches the file for free space and then returns a IndexEntry which uses the space. (O(log(n)) memory accesses if space is in the ConcurrentSkipListMap of free spaces or O(log(n)+n) if not)

Specified by:
allocateRecord in class BaseRecordsFile
Throws:
java.io.IOException
RecordsFileException

getIndexAt

protected IndexEntry getIndexAt(long targetFp)
                         throws RecordsFileException
Returns the record to which the target file pointer belongs - meaning the specified location in the file is part of the record data of the IndexEntry which is returned. Returns null if the location is not part of a record. (O(n) mem accesses)

Specified by:
getIndexAt in class BaseRecordsFile
Throws:
RecordsFileException
